content.full_text:
Frank Leathe to Abraham Lincoln, 27 November 18481 I am engaged in collecting the autographs of American Statesmen. The high position
               you occupy has imparted to me a desire to possess your own. I am particularly anxious
               to add it to my list as you are the onlyWhigmember from yourstate. If you should think proper to honor me by noticing this communication you will confer
               a favor for which I shall feel grateful.
paragraphs: Frank Leathe to Abraham Lincoln, 27 November 18481

I am engaged in collecting the autographs of American Statesmen. The high position
               you occupy has imparted to me a desire to possess your own. I am particularly anxious
               to add it to my list as you are the onlyWhigmember from yourstate. If you should think proper to honor me by noticing this communication you will confer
               a favor for which I shall feel grateful.

footnotes.text: 1Frank Leathe wrote this letter in its entirety.
2Abraham Lincolnâ€™s response, if he penned one, has not been located.
